structure.unit: LICENSING OF MOTOR VEHICLES, OPERATORS, AND TRAILERS

law.catch_line: Branch offices for issuance of licenses.
law.text: In any county, the county clerk and the circuit clerk may maintain branch offices in each legislative district for the purpose of issuing motor vehicle registration plates and drivers' licenses. These offices may be located in volunteer fire department stations or in other buildings used for a public purpose.
law.history: Created 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 55, sec. 2, effective June 18, 1970.
